results.title: Space in the seventies: exploration of the planets
results.creator_credit: Graphic Films, National Aeronautics and Space Administration, Lester Novros and Colin Cantwell
results.brief_description: This film very briefly covers the early notions we had about space, and then progresses to actual data collected from space flights to the Moon, Mars and Saturn. Information and findings are presented by artists’ impressions, animation, and computer printouts. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Space flight
results.brief_description: Made by a special “Plasti-Cine” technique, in this film the hero, Dan, passes an amusing set of tests for health fitness, then flies a space rocket to the planet Venus. After battling the demon Nicotine, Dan persuades the Venusians to destroy the groves of cigarette trees to abolish smoking.

results.title: Space cowboys
results.creator_credit: Mad Chance, Clint Eastwood, Clipsal Films, Village Roadshow Pictures and Malpaso Company
results.brief_description: In the 1950s, a US test pilot team, codenamed Team Daedalus, have been training to become the first Americans in space. They are passed over by NASA who decide to send a chimp instead. Over the years, Frank Corvin (Clint Eastwood), Hawk Hawkins (Tommy Lee Jones), Jerry O’Neill (Donald Sutherland) and Tank Sullivan (James Garner) have been forgotten and move onto other professions - Corvin becomes an aerospace engineer, Hawkins, a freelance pilot, Sullivan, a Baptist minister, and O’Neill, an astrophysicist who designs roller coasters in his free time. The four all live a quiet life until NASA learns that a Russian satellite will crash into earth, causing a major communication blackout, unless a failure in the satellite’s system can be repaired. When NASA discovers that the satellite’s system is identical to one Corvin designed, they ask him for help. He agrees, but only if he can do the repairs himself and that the original Team Daedalus can come along as his crew. ‘Space cowboys’ was produced and directed by Clint Eastwood. Cast also includes James Cromwell, Marcia Gay Harden, Courtney B. Vance, Loren Dean and William Devane.

results.title: Space connection
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew and Ernest Reid
results.brief_description: A report on Canada’s progress in space telecommunications technology. The film reviews developments from the first Alouette satellite to the Anik II and the projected solar-powered satellite designed to be the forerunner of a new generation of powerful communications satellites. What these satellites look like, how they are lofted into orbital position, and how they function to give Canada reliable, broad-range transmission, are clearly illustrated and explained for all audiences.

results.title: Space colony
results.brief_description: Interactive game where you create your own city with each residential structure being sufficiently resourced with food, water and energy to maintain the population. The player wins the game when they have reached the target population of 10,000. Based on real time strategy and city simulation games.

results.title: Space ballet: a story of Apollo 9
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: The flight of Apollo 9 to splashdown on March 13, 1969, showing the flight of the Lunar Module, the first in space history. Emphasis is placed on the human aspects of the flight. Music is from the feature film, “Yellow Submarine”. Narrated by Pernell Roberts.

results.title: SPAA Conference 2002
results.brief_description: The Screen Producers Conference is the key national industry conference and is to be held in Melbourne 2001, 2002 and 2003. The conference delegates represent the major broadcast networks, production houses and independent producers in Australia. The Conference is a three day event and usually coincides with the annual Australian Film Institute (AFI)Awards.

results.title: Soylent green
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Walter Seltzer, Russell Thacher and Richard Fleischer
results.brief_description: The year is 2022. New York City is teeming with a writhing mass of 40 million citizens, most of whom are unemployed. Strawberry jam costs $150.00 a jar and voluntary death is encouraged by Government Clinics. Food as we know it is very scarce and the people rely on a biscuit-like foodstuff called Soylent. Detective Thorn (Charlton Heston) is a harried cop investigating the death of a rich magnate (Joseph Cotten) in the dictatorial Soylent company. Edward G. Robinson, in his final screen role plays an aged and wise researcher who remembers what the earth was like with trees, vegetables and democracy. As the threads of the murder unravel, Heston finds himself face to face with the hideous truth about Soylent. Displaying an intensity of poetic and visual invention, this provocative film is a nightmarish vision of a world slowly choking itself to death. Based upon the novel by Harry Harrison.

results.title: Sown pastures
results.brief_description: A record of an experiment carried out at the CSIRO Research Station, Armidale, N.S.W., which shows the improvement in health and wool returns of sheep grazing sown pastures compared with those grazing natural pasture. Coloured graphs are used to show more clearly the differences between these two groups of sheep.
